abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the person is the user of the device.
overview:
## Discussion

It’s essential that you set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for the current device user when creating an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson] object for use with [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SiriKit/messaging] intents. For example, if the sender of an outgoing message is also the user of the device, set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. Similarly, when creating the recipient array for an incoming message—which should include the current device user—set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for the person in the recipient list that is the current device user, and set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for all other recipients.

To set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe], call the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/init(personHandle:nameComponents:displayName:image:contactIdentifier:customIdentifier:isMe:)] method when creating the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson] object.

# isMe

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the person is the user of the device.

## Declaration

```swift
var isMe: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

It’s essential that you set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for the current device user when creating an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson] object for use with [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SiriKit/messaging] intents. For example, if the sender of an outgoing message is also the user of the device, set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. Similarly, when creating the recipient array for an incoming message—which should include the current device user—set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for the person in the recipient list that is the current device user, and set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for all other recipients.

To set [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/isMe], call the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson/init(personHandle:nameComponents:displayName:image:contactIdentifier:customIdentifier:isMe:)] method when creating the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPerson] object.

## Accessing the person’s identity

- **personHandle**: The unique handle that your app assigns to the person.
- **image**: An image of the person.
- **aliases**: The additional handles that Siri may use to identify the person.
